channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet Cathy Tie, Bride of “China’s Frankenstein”
item.description: Since the Chinese biophysicist He Jiankui was released from prison in 2022, he has sought to make a scientific comeback and to repair his reputation a...

item.title: Long-term-bond selloff is a buying opportunity, says Bank of America
item.description: Investor skepticism towards long-duration assets is a global phenomenon in 2025.

item.title: My ex-wife said she should have been compensated for working part time during our marriage. Do I owe her?
item.description: “My ex-wife and I both recently retired from federal government jobs, and have comfortable retirements.”

item.title: The Download: meet Cathy Tie, and Anthropic’s new AI models

item.title: Why enterprise RAG systems fail: Google study introduces ‘sufficient context’ solution
item.description: Google's "sufficient context" helps refine RAG systems, reduce LLM hallucinations, and boost AI reliability for business applications.

item.title: AI chatbots taking over the internet aren’t just shaping your opinions. They’re threatening your personal data.
item.description: Social media is being transformed into an arena where artificial voices shape and drown out human conversation.

item.title: After GPT-4o backlash, researchers benchmark models on moral endorsement—find sycophancy persists across the board
item.description: A new benchmark can test how much LLMs become sycophants, and found that GPT-4o was the most sycophantic of the models tested.

item.title: ARM Institute appoints Jorgen Pedersen as new CEO
item.description: Jorgen Pedersen, an industry veteran and former CEO of RE2 Robotics, will take the top spot at the Pittsburgh-based consortium. The post ARM Institute...

item.title: This hedge-fund manager has made about 50% in each of the last two years. Here’s his home run trade.
item.description: Rob Citrone thinks the U.S. will keep its exceptionalism and the economy will boom in 2026

item.title: Anthropic faces backlash to Claude 4 Opus behavior that contacts authorities, press if it thinks you’re doing something ‘egregiously immoral’
item.description: Bowman later edited his tweet and the following one in a thread to read as follows, but it still didn't convince the naysayers.

item.title: Time Magazine appears to accidentally publish embargoed story confirming new Anthropic model
item.description: Someone also appears to have published a full scrape of the Time article online on the news aggregator app Newsbreak.
